intro: Myrceugenia miersiana var. macahensis, commonly known as the Macaheña myrtle, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
